name: Box

props.name: centerContent
props.description: Center inner content (layout inside the box)

props.name: fullWidth
props.description: Stretch to 100% width of container when true

props.name: alignX
props.description: Horizontal placement of the box when not fullWidth

props.name: centered
props.description: Deprecated: old prop name retained for BC

props.name: preset
props.description: One or many style-preset names registered via `definePreset()`

props.name: pad
props.description: Container padding as units or CSS length.

props.name: compact
props.description: Compact mode zeros gap and pad where supported.

bestPractices: Treat as the neutral building block: backgrounds, padding, and simple width/height constraints.
Prefer theme tokens to inherit correct contrast automatically; if you set `background`, ensure text remains accessible.
Reach for `Panel` when you need separation (borders/elevation); keep visually semantic elements distinct.
Use spacing tokens; prefer numeric values over hardâ€‘coded CSS so density scales with the theme.
Align purposefully: use `alignX` and `fullWidth` for placement; avoid deprecated `centered`.
Reuse styles via `preset` (`definePreset()`) instead of duplicating `sx`.
When Box represents a semantic region, add appropriate roles/labels (e.g., `role="region"`, `aria-label`) via DOM passthrough.

examples.title: Full width with outline
examples.code:
<Box fullWidth sx={{ border: '1px dashed currentColor', padding: '0.5rem' }}>
  <Typography>Stretch me</Typography>
</Box>

examples.title: Background + padding
examples.code:
<Box background={theme.colors['tertiary']} sx={{ padding: theme.spacing(1) }}>
  <Typography>Readable on themed background</Typography>
</Box>
